title: How much are the Kindle books? - Quora

response.answer_text: Generally lower than hard copy. Yes. If you buy a book on Kindle then it will cost you less than hard copy. There are lot of free books too and above that they are classics such as War and Peace , Great Expectations , Sense and sensibility and many more. Almost all the great classics are free in Kindle. ⬇️  You can buy books and there will be discounts. I bought a book of George Orwell ,' 1984′ . It cost me approx. Rs. 150. ⬇️ I saved 5%.  You can also redeem your gift card to get more offer. Prices will vary. You can download the 'Kindle' app on your mobile phone too. ( Kindle is glare free , but if you read in Mobile phone you will have a disadvantage of this . )

A book on Kindle can be .99 to retail price around $15–25. I subscribe to Kindle Unlimited to read books for free. I can borrow up to ten books at a time. I also get emails with offers of free to $4.99. I also borrow books from the library for free to read in Kindle format on my Kindle.
